fields.headline: Lindsay quits Lowe job
fields.bodyText: Tim Lindsay, the worldwide president of advertising agency Lowe since 2001, is leaving the practice after eight years to pursue other interests. Mr Lindsay, who is based in London, is expected to stay at the agency until the end of the year. Jerry Judge, the chief executive of Lowe & Partners Worldwide, said Mr Lindsay's position would not be filled. "While I was disappointed by Tim's decision to leave the agency, I respect his wish to take stock of his personal and professional aspirations at this point in his career," said Mr Judge. "He has been a valued partner to me, and he will be sorely missed. I very much appreciate his willingness to remain on board for several months to affect a smooth transition." Mr Lindsay joined the London agency in 1995 as managing director. He was president of Europe from 1999 to 2001. · To contact the MediaGuardian newsdesk email editor@mediatheguardian.com or phone 020 7239 9857
